name: Modbus data to postgresql
info:
* The data from the modbus simulator is fetched using modbus read node
* Then using the function node to write the data in postgresql
* the function node data is passed to the postgresql node which writes data to the table.

Publish Modbus Coil Status data to MQTT broker
Coil Status Register
info:
Modbus coils are packed as bits inside bytes. Here's how it works:

Modbus coils are 1 bit each.

But Modbus protocol sends whole bytes (8 bits).

So if you ask for 10 coils:

Modbus will send 2 bytes (16 bits).

Youll receive 16 coil statuses (even though only first 10 are relevant).

Example: You requested 10 coils
 Modbus sends 2 full bytes  16 bits  16 coil values
 Only first 10 are meaningful  the remaining 6 are just padded/extra bits (typically false)
